Planets

Planets are made from dust cloud (History Tracers, 2024 ; NASA, Stars). When the formation process starts, the particle sample is too small (Morfill, G., et al., 1978, pp. 212, 216 - 217 ; Birnstiel, T., et al., 2016, pp. 42). When the cloud starts to collapse, the dust grain begins to approximate and collide, they arrive to a large sample, that are named as planitesimals (Birnstiel, T., et al., 2016, pp. 46 - 47).

Practice 1: Making planetesimals
Put on top of a paper some grains, for example, sand or beans. It is important that they will be separated.
Despite we cannot see, the paper, that represents the space, like the cloud dust, it also has more gas than grains.
Now, begin moving and folding the paper slowly until you can unify the grains.
When they grains are together, you have your "planetesimal".

Before to proceed, a short observation: normally it is taught that gravity force is attracting matter according to the mass the body has. This is not true for all known models, as it is explained by Sabine Hossenfelder (Hossenfelder, Sabine, 2024 ; Hossenfelder, Sabine, 2021) and Dr. Don Lincoln (Lincoln, Don, 2023).

The planetesimal continues attracting particle making a bigger structure, that is named protoplanets. Finally, in a slow process, the protoplanet will continue receiving more matter, to reach the level of a planet (Leinhardt, Zoe M., and Derek C. Richardson., 2005).

There is a relative consensus about how the planets are made, now when we talk about the planet definition, this was modified recently to: an object sufficient big, rounded by its gravitational orbit around a star, capable to keep distant other planetary objects (Library of Congress, 2023 ; Hogeback, J., 2016).

Molecules

The planetesimals are made from collisions of small grains until they reach giant structures, but there is an intermediate structure that we did not explore yet, the molecules.

Molecules are a group of two or more atoms that together are a pure substance, they can be split and still keep chemical properties of a substance (Britannica, T. Editors of Encyclopaedia).

The first molecules made in the space happened probably during recombination period (NASA, Universe), period where there were no dust grains, but there were already atoms, so we could have small molecules, like Hydrogen molecules, H2 (Lepp, S., and J. M. Shull, 1984). The technology advance have allowed a better understanding about the region between stars, interstellar. It was already observed 170 molecules, among them, the water, H2O, Ammonium, and NH3 (Tielens, A. G. G. M., 2013, pp. 1023 - 1024 ).

Some molecules that are present in the living beings can be also found out of our planet, in addition to water, it was already found distinct acids (Liu, Sheng‐Yuan, et al., 2001 ; Sanz-Novo, Miguel, et al., 2023 ; Puletti, Fabrizio, et al., 2010). The arrival of these molecules to planets, allowing the emergence of the life, could be due to comets (McKay, Adam J., and Nathan X. Roth.).

Grouping for life

We are composed of different molecules, like the plants and other animals around us, and we live together in a planet. This observation, could lead us to the conclusion that with molecules and a planet we could have life, but if this were true, other planets nearby would also have life. What are we missing in our observation?

Firstly, it is necessary to define regions where it is possible to have planets supporting life. These regions are known as habitable zones of a stellar system. Planets in this region must have at least (Ramirez, Ramses, 2018 ; Sacani, Sérgio, 2020): :

  • Liquid water on its surface (De La Torre, Lizbeth B., 2022).
  • The planet must be a rock planet, like our planet.
  • The energy received from a star must allow a temperature capable to support life like we know.
  • Natural processes that create Carbon and Silicon cycles, like the tectonic plates (National Geographic).
. Another factor that is necessary to highlight, it is the fact that habitable zones also have relationship with star size (Waltham, David, 2017).

When a planet is formed in a habitable zone, the molecules to make the life in this planet can finally to group, but as Carl H. Gibson et al. highlight, the process to create life in the planet can be expanded to bigger horizons (Gibson, Carl H., et al., 2011):

  • Chemical product made for the life, are primary created into protogalaxy center (Gibson, Carl H., et al., 2011, pp. 10).
  • Considering efficiency, the life can have arisen from "seeds" instead of "inorganic soup" (Gibson, Carl H., et al., 2011, pp. 21).
  • There is no guarantee that lives appear by abiogenesis (Gibson, Carl H., et al., 2011, pp. 22 - 23).

It is necessary to remember the reader, that contradictions are part of the science, and we cannot discard completely the idea of an inorganic soup, according to this scenario, Lena Vicente et al. studied different ways to test hypothesis to arise of the life (Vincent, Lena, et al., 2021).

The period of emergence of life is directly related to the chosen model (Gibson, Carl H., et al., 2011, pp. 10 - 11). By the HGD model (Gibson, Carl H., and Rudolph E. Schild., 2010), like it was cited, it happened after protogalaxies formation (Gibson, Carl H., et al., 2011, pp. 11), while by ΛCDMHC (Gibson, Carl H., and Rudolph E. Schild., 2010), it happens more recently (Gibson, Carl H., et al., 2011, pp. 11). For the terrestrial case, the life, "biology", would arise millions of years after the earth to be made (Harari, Yuval Noah, 2014, pp. 14, 18).

Questions

    Answer next questions:
  1. The steps to make a planet are: planets lose mass by gravitational forces making a protoplanet that are disintegrated into planetesimals, finally it is transformed into dust grain? .
  2. When a pure substance is broken, can we still identify the molecules because they keep chemical properties? .
  3. Do we have the life, living beings, in a planet only with specific conditions? .
